title: Squid Bikes Maybe Dead 26″ Rigid MTB
content:
Remember that sweet Squid Bikes rigid MTB, dubbed the Maybe Dead, we featured in our 2024 MADE Coverage? Well they’ve finally landed…

These Maybe Dead rigid MTB frames ($2,100) use 26″ wheels, disc brakes, and have a UDH derailleur hanger. They’re made in California by Prandus and are non-boost spaced. If you want to run the Maybe Dead singlespeed, there’s a press-fit shell, ready for the Oner eccentric bottom bracket, too.

 

Specs:

  • $2,100 frame and fork
  • Double-butted tubing throughout
  • 12×142 rear and 12×100 front spacing
  • UDH dropout allows for T-TYPE derailleurs
  • 27.2 seatpost
  • 73mm PF30 bottom bracket (ONER ready for single speeding)
  • 26×2.4 Tire Clearance
  • 34/34EC headset (not included)
  • Made in USA by PRANDUS

See more at Squid Bikes.

The post Squid Bikes Maybe Dead 26″ Rigid MTB appeared first on The Radavist.
author: John Watson
